title: Autonomous Driving Radar Target Detection Defense Project Using Adversarial Deep Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Statistics, Calculus, Matrix Operations, Python Programming, and Neural Network Fundamentals
context.additional_context: Hands-on classes using digital devices (tablets/laptops), combining mathematical principles of radar signal processing with machine learning application examples in project-based learning

learning_goals: Learners can mathematically interpret Range-Doppler maps generated during the signal processing of FMCW radar.
Learners can identify three or more vulnerabilities in deep learning models by analyzing adversarial attack cases.
Learners can build a hybrid deep learning model applying PSO optimization techniques and achieve target detection accuracy of 85% or higher.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
